Comments_List: I learned how to think in this class.  I learned how to encounter a material text and unpack its every details to reveal more about its context and the culture which produced it.

This class was a new experience for me. Working with the books and manuscripts in Beinecke was a little overwhelming at first, as the class progressed I started to feel more comfortable working with and handling the materials. I thought that the weekly assignments were very challenging, but extremely effective for deeply engaging with the materials.

this was a truly unique class and Peter is an excellent teacher of intellectual thought.  His enthusiasm for the material is infectious, and it was exciting to be in conversation with such an incredible scholar.

This is a fascinating course about some of the unexpected and intertwined histories of printing and manuscript. Peter Stallybrass has unbridled energy and knows so much; it is a joy to learn from him. At times the class discussion could meander a bit, but for a crash course in thinking about material texts, this class is a great way to work with one of the most influential and inventive book historians around today.
Yes.  This is a marvelous class and suits a student willing to explore beyond their own period or specification.
It was such a privilege to have access to Beinecke's vast resources. I enjoyed looking at different materials every class, and being a part of the discussion each week.
